result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
10:15 AM Defendant TYLER A HARDEL in court.  Attorney William Scott Nelson appeared by video for TYLER A HARDEL.  Attorney Matt McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Statement by Atty Nelson regarding motion to modify bond. Statement by ADA McElroy - objects to bond modification and states reasons. Statement by the Court - denies motion to modify bond.

Court adjourned at 10:18 AM
Motion hearing on November 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defendant's
Return date on November 21, 2022 at 10:30 am.

3:43 PM Defendant TYLER A HARDEL in court, in custody.  Attorney William Scott Nelson in court for TYLER A HARDEL on 2022CF31.  Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Nelson states the defendant will waive the preliminary hearing. Defendant concurs. Court instructs the defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary examination. Defendant waives his/her right to a preliminary examination. Court finds probable cause. Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial. 

State files an information with the court, same as the criminal complaint and copy to Atty Nelson. Attorney Nelson acknowledges receipt of the information and waives any reading. Atty Nelson enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant. Court will set both cases for Return Date on November 21, 2022 at 10:30 AM.

Court adjourned at 3:46 PM
Preliminary Hearing - Schedule or Waiver on September 13, 2022 at 03:45 pm.
(Atty Scott Nelson)
Second appearance on September 13, 2022 at 03:45 pm.

2:08 PM Defendant TYLER A HARDEL in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael J Kapelis appeared by video for TYLER A HARDEL on 2021CF151. Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls 2021CF151 & 2022CF31. Short discussion before going on the record, defendant reached out to Atty Vinz, but she is retiring. Statement by defendant re: counsel. Court will not appoint counsel as the defendant qualifies for court appointment. Statement by defendant re: counsel. 

Court adjourned at 2:11 PM

Court will set for Status of Counsel on September 13, 2022 at 3:45 PM.
Second appearance scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 03:45 pm.
Second appearance on August 1, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

11:15 AM Defendant TYLER A HARDEL in court, in custody.  Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Michael J Kapelis in court for TYLER A HARDEL on 2021CF151. Court calls 2022CF31 & 2021CF151. Statement by Atty Kapelis - defendant is requesting Atty Kapelis to withdraw and makes oral motion. Defendant concurs. Further statement by defendant - requests Attorney Kapelis to stay on his case at this time. Statement by the Court. Court questions Atty kapelis. Statement by Atty kapelis - has no issue staying on the case. Court sets for Status of Hearing on June 21, 2022 at 11:00 AM.

10:08 AM Defendant TYLER A HARDEL in court, in custody.  Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin. Court notes Atty Kapelis represents the defendant on his other case. Court adjourned at 10:09 AM

Order to Withdraw (Atty Michael Kapelis)

9:00 AM Defendant TYLER A HARDEL in court, in custody.  Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Michael J Kapelis in court for TYLER A HARDEL. Statement by Atty kapelis, the defendant requests Atty Kapelis to withdraw from the case. Defendant concurs. Defendant waives the time limits so he can get counsel. Statement by the defendant regarding counsel. Statement by the Court regarding counsel. Court will grant the motion for Atty Kapelis to withdraw. Court will set for Status of Counsel on May 24, 2022 at 10:00 AM.

Court adjourned at 9:03 AM
Preliminary Hearing - Schedule or Waiver on April 26, 2022 at 08:45 am.

8:34 AM Defendant TYLER A HARDEL in court, in custody.  Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin. Court goes over right to counsel and how to obtain one. Court goes over right to a preliminary hearing and the time limits. Defendant requests an attorney. Court will tell Atty Kapelis that defendant wants an attorney on this case. Statement by the Court regarding counsel. Court will take this as a time limit waiver until he gets an attorney. 

Court adjourned at 8:37 AM

9:05 AM Defendant TYLER A HARDEL in court.  Attorney Matt McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count. Court instructs defendant of his/her right to an attorney. Off the record. 9:07 AM. Back on the record 9:28 AM. Defendant TYLER A HARDEL in court.  Attorney Michael Kapelis appeared in court for the defendant. Attorney Matt McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Kapelis confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading and requests a preliminary hearing. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count. ADA McElroy makes bond recommendation. Atty Kapelis makes bond recommendation. Court sets bond at $50,000 cash bond and conditions of: No contact with anybody under the age of 18. Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision. Not to possess any electronic device that connects to the internet with audio or video. Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.   Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing. Defendant does not waive the time limits. Court will set for Preliminary Hearing for April 5, 2022 at 8:30 AM.


Court adjourned at 9:32 AM.

Defendant called to inform us that he is in the Dodge County Jail serving a one year sentence, attempting to get transferred to Green Lake and has transportation to get to his court dates. Mailing address can remain as it is, someone is at that address and will get him the mail.
**PROCESSING NEEDED**
